org.magnos.io.buffer
Class BufferFactoryBinary

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.io.buffer.AbstractBufferFactory
      org.magnos.io.buffer.BufferFactoryBinary
All Implemented Interfaces:
BufferFactory, Transferable<java.nio.ByteBuffer>
public class BufferFactoryBinary
extends AbstractBufferFactory

A BufferFactory where all cached buffers have a power-of-2 size within a range, defined by powers. If the range of powers are 8 and 14 this means the buffers cached will be of sizes {256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, 16384} since 2^8 is 256 and 2^14 is 16374. Any buffers smaller or larger requested will be allocated on the fly as HeapByteBuffers.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Constructor Detail

BufferFactoryBinary

public BufferFactoryBinary(int minPower,
                           int maxPower)
Instantiates a new BufferFactoryBinary.

Parameters:
minPower - The number that determines the smallest buffer size pooled, minimum buffer size = 2^minPower. Any request for a buffer smaller then the minimum size returns a HeapByteBuffer.
maxPower - The number that determines the largest buffer size pooled, maximum buffer size = 2^maxPower. Any request for a buffer larger then the maximum size returns a HeapByteBuffer.
Method Detail

onAllocate

protected java.nio.ByteBuffer onAllocate(int size,
                                         java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean cache)
Requests that the implementation allocate a ByteBuffer with a capacity greater than or equal to the given size. If the implementation was able to take a buffer from cache it should invoke cache.set(true).

Specified by:
onAllocate in class AbstractBufferFactory
Parameters:
size - The minimum capacity of the buffer to allocate.
cache - The flag to set to true if the buffer was taken from cache and not allocated on the spot.
Returns:
The ByteBuffer allocated. The capacity must be greater than or equal to the given size, but the ByteBuffers properties (position, limit) have no required state.

onCache

protected boolean onCache(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
Provides the implementation with a ByteBuffer to cache if it chooses to do so. If the implementation cannot or will not cache the given buffer it should return false, if the buffer is cached for later retrieval then true should be returned.

Specified by:
onCache in class AbstractBufferFactory
Parameters:
buffer - The buffer to attempt to cache.
Returns:
True if the buffer was cached, otherwise false.

onFill

protected long onFill()
Requires the implementation to fill its cache with the maximum amount of cached memory (or a sensible amount) and return the amount of memory which was allocated to fill the cache (if any).

Specified by:
onFill in class AbstractBufferFactory
Returns:
The amount of memory allocated to fill the factory.

onRelease

protected java.util.List<java.nio.ByteBuffer> onRelease()
Requires the implementation to iterate over all cached buffers (if any) and remove each one from the cache and add it to a List structure.

Specified by:
onRelease in class AbstractBufferFactory
Returns:
The list of ByteBuffers taken from the implementations cache.
